name: CREOATE
slogan: Democratising retail for independent businesses across the world
description: CREOATE is on a mission to revolutionise the way retailers discover and buy products from independent brands. We use machine learning, enterprise software and power of community to build a platform for wholesale trade, helping create a fair and sustainable economy for independent businesses.

team.name: Ashley Horn
team.bioHtml: Founder @CREOATE • Passionate about creativity; Worked at @Deloitte, @Lloyds Banking Group

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
CREOATE is on a mission to revolutionise the way retailers discover and buy products from independent brands. Led by a founding team with VC experience (Job and Talent, Outfittery) and top tier management advisory (Deloitte), we are using machine learning, enterprise software and power of community to build a sustainable platform for retailers and brands to discover and trade with each other around the world. 

CREOATE’S community of high quality, ambitious brands is critical to our value proposition to retailers across the UK, Europe and USA. Brand acquisition and development is a key part of our success, supporting our drive to make sure amazing and most relevant brands build their global empires using our platform and support as their launch pad. 

By joining us as a Business Development Manager, you are directly contributing to the regeneration of our high streets and CREOATE’s success by growing our catalogue of unique and relevant products. 
We are a fast growing team and need a self-starter who loves to build communities and enjoys setting ambitious goals and their relentless pursuit. You will be expected to lead and scale quickly and manage a high-volume pipeline of leads. We love people who communicate clearly but openly, and enjoy working as a team with an eye on individual targets. You have a passion for entrepreneurship and change, and don’t give up no matter what. And you love the opportunity to join a high growth, soon to be global start-up at its foundational stage, and will be instrumental in making CREOATE the most sustainable, trusted platform for independent brands to build their retail distribution and for retailers to discover and purchase products their customers will love.
We believe in entrepreneurship as a way of life, and will continue to empower independents as together we shape the future of retail across the world. 

You will be part of our fast paced growth team and will lead the following initiatives:
•	Own and develop a pipeline of thousands of unique, independent brands often interacting with hundreds per week
•	Manage and improve our sales cycle and on-boarding process from lead to the day the brand is live on our platform
•	Accelerate timeline from sourced lead to an active 
•	Work closely with our Retailer, Operations and Tech teams to nurture our community of independent brands and retailers 
•	Comfortable developing and implementing A/B tests to drive inbound and outbound sales
•	Master and continuously improve on our community values and messaging, processes, tactics and sales strategy
•	Represent CREOATE at UK and international events to build our community and network  

What we love:
•	Undergrad degree and 1-3 years of start-up sales experience
•	Hands on experience in managing sales accounts/funnels
•	Analytical skills and track record of creative problem solving 
•	Passion to support start-ups and independent businesses, and networking at events 
•	Hunger for a fast-paced environment with constant growth and change

jobs.title: Growth Marketing Executive
jobs.description:
CREOATE is on a mission to revolutionise the way retailers discover and buy products for their businesses. 

Buying and selling should be simple and transparent things. Somewhere along the way, they got complicated and out of reach for small businesses. 
We’re working hard to make commerce easy for everyone.

Led by a founding team with VC experience (Job and Talent, Outfittery) and top tier management advisory (Deloitte), we are using machine learning, enterprise software and power of community to build a sustainable platform for retailers and brands to discover and trade with each other around the world. 

**Your Role**
•	You will be joining CREOATE at an exciting stage of our evolution and directly contributing to the regeneration of our high streets. 
•	As an early member of the Growth Marketing team, you will be joining a small team that collaborates closely and focused on showing great product/market fit and growth. 
• You will have ownership and become a leader in customer acquisition and retention across all channels. 
•	We are data-driven in everything we do: you will test and measure all of your communications, running many tests at any point in time.
•	We are a fast growing team and need a self-starter who loves to build communities and enjoys setting ambitious goals and their relentless pursuit. You will be expected to lead and scale quickly and execute on ambitious growth targets. 
•	You have a passion for entrepreneurship and change, and don’t give up no matter what. 
•	We believe in entrepreneurship as a way of life, and will continue to empower independents as together we shape the future of retail across the world.

**You will be part of our fast paced team and will lead the following initiatives:**
•	Use data collection tools to determine a baseline for what’s happening across our marketplace, reach out to customers, look at trends, and have a thirst for solving “how can we build upon this?”

•	Work closely across leadership, business development and product teams to create and execute on a robust growth strategy, including a timeline of initiatives to drive growth in marketplace GMV

**What we love:**
•	Undergrad degree and 1-3+ years of hands on growth marketing or other relevant work experience (product, engineering, analytics, or business operations) at a high-growth tech startup

• Must have experience of running multi-channel lead generation campaigns, and be able to track and measure results from these

•	Background in statistics, product design/UX principles or branding, and demonstrable knowledge of split testing, copywriting and funnel building

•	Strong grasp of one or more of: virality, email marketing, paid social ads

• Knowledge of marketing automation and CRM systems such as MailChimp and Hubspot

•	Preferred: understanding code and know how to hack specifically on front end technologies including HTML, JavaScript, and CSS 

•	Self-starter who can ramp quickly, and excel in a fast-moving environment 

•	Passion to support start-ups and independent businesses, and a hunger for a fast-paced environment with constant growth and change
